q: $ 2.54 billion in the fourth quarter of 2010 from$ 1.97 billion in the same quarter a year ago. Revenue was up 26 per cent to$ 8.44 billion from the same period last year. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile, Eric Schmidt said. "These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth- investments that will benefit our users, Google Inc. and the wider web," he said.

At practice Wednesday, Michael Vick loosened up throwing passes to Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan, who is making his first Pro Bowl appearance in his third season and succeeded Michael Vick in Atlanta. Matt is great. The coaching staff is great. We're just having a good time, he said. "I like what they're doing in the offense and it's been easy. We're going to go out and try to have fun and everybody enjoy each other." Michael Vick

Packers ahead 7-0 on their way to a 21-14 victory. "He's like a very good scorer in basketball- you know he's going to get points," Steelers defensive coordinator Dick LeBeau said. From a defensive standpoint, you've got to keep him from controlling the game and monopolizing the game. That's what we have to try and do with Rodgers. He's a great player. He can create, improvise with his feet, go to his second and third choice in the route because he has such a quick release. The 6-foot-5, 241-pound Ben Roethlisberger isn't as speedy as Rodgers or Michael Vick nor as statuesque as Tom Brady and Peyton Manning ; he just makes it work. expert. "By advertising that the show isn't going to be as mean, they might be losing their professional credibility," says Robert Thompson, a professor of TV and pop culture at Syracuse University. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the( judging) room saying, " Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn"t work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler .
